Ok. This is the math. The earth is 93 million miles away from the sun. The sun is around 870,000 miles across. Therefor: (93,000,000x2+870,000)xpi= The circumferential of which the earth orbits the sun. Which is actually 587 million miles. I know I was off by a few miles but the suns distance doesn't really affect it much.

Basically:
Red, green and blue are light primaries because they are subtractive. Cyan, Magenta and Yellow are additive primaries. Subtractive primaries combine to create more light, hence all three together make white. Additive colors reflect light absorbing all but their own hue, hence all three together make "black."

Ok. If we're counting by leap year, 366x24x60 = 527,040
If we're counting technical year being 365.25, it would be 365.25x24x60 = 525,960
If we're counting just 365, it would be 365x24x60 = 525,600
